definitions.text: (law) a right or legal share of something; a financial involvement with something
examples: they have interests all over the world
a stake in the company's future

definitions.text: a pole or stake set up to mark something (as the start or end of a race track)
examples: a pair of posts marked the goal
the corner of the lot was indicated by a stake

definitions.text: instrument of execution consisting of a vertical post that a victim is tied to for burning
the money risked on a gamble
a strong wooden or metal post with a point at one end so it can be driven into the ground

examples: I will stake my good reputation for this
I'm betting on the new horse

definitions.text: tie or fasten to a stake
kill by piercing with a spear or sharp pole
examples: the enemies were impaled and left to die
